v-alert/title.description: Specify a title text for the component.

v-alert/text.description: Specify content text for the component.

v-alert/border-color.description: Specifies the color of the border. Accepts any color value.

v-alert/closable.description: Adds a close icon that can hide the alert.

v-alert/prominent.description: Displays a larger vertically centered icon to draw more attention.

v-alert/border.description: Adds a colored border to the component.

v-alert/type.description: Create a specialized alert that uses a contextual color and has a pre-defined icon.

v-alert/close-icon.description: Change the default icon used for **closable** alerts.

v-alert/close-label.description: Text used for *aria-label* on **closable** alerts. Can also be customized globally in [Internationalization](/customization/internationalization).

v-alert/icon.description: Apply a specific icon using the [v-icon](/components/icons/) component.

v-alert/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array

v-alert/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

v-alert/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

v-alert/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

v-alert/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

v-alert/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

v-alert/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

v-alert/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

v-alert/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

v-alert/location.description: Specifies the component's location. Can combine by using a space separated string

v-alert/position.description: Specifies the type of positioning method used for the component.

v-alert/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. You can find more information on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

v-alert/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-alert/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children

v-alert/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors)

v-app-bar/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

v-app-bar/height.description: Designates a specific height for the toolbar. Overrides the heights imposed by other props, e.g. **prominent**, **dense**, **extended**, etc.

v-app-bar/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

v-app-bar/location.description: Aligns the component towards the top or bottom.

v-app-bar/absolute.description: Applies position: absolute to the component.

v-app-bar/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. You can find more information on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

v-app-bar/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children

Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors)

v-app-bar/name.description: Assign a specific name for layout registration.

v-app-bar/image.description: Specifies a [v-img](/components/images) as the component's background.

v-app-bar/scroll-behavior.description: Specify an action to take when the scroll position of **scroll-target** reaches **scroll-threshold**. Accepts any combination of hide, inverted, collapse, elevate, and fade-image. Multiple values can be used, separated by a space.

v-app-bar/collapse.description: Morphs the component into a collapsed state, reducing its maximum width.

v-app-bar/extended.description: Use this prop to increase the height of the toolbar _without_ using the `extension` slot for adding content. May be used in conjunction with the **extension-height** prop, and any of the other props that affect the height of the toolbar, e.g. **prominent**, **dense**, etc., **WITH THE EXCEPTION** of **height**.

v-app-bar/extension-height.description: Designate an explicit height for the `extension` slot.

v-app-bar/order.description: Adjust the order of the component in relation to its registration order.

v-app-bar/scroll-target.description: The element to target for scrolling events. Uses `window` by default.

v-app-bar/scroll-threshold.description: The amount of scroll distance down before **scroll-behavior** activates.

v-app-bar-nav-icon/symbol.description: The [Symbol](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Symbol) used to hook into group functionality for components like [v-btn-toggle](/components/btn-toggle) and [v-bottom-navigation](/components/bottom-navigations/)

v-app-bar-nav-icon/text.description: Specify content text for the component.

v-app-bar-nav-icon/icon.description: Apply a specific icon using the [v-icon](/components/icons/) component. The button will become _round_.

v-app-bar-nav-icon/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

v-app-bar-nav-icon/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

v-app-bar-nav-icon/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

v-app-bar-nav-icon/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

v-app-bar-nav-icon/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

v-app-bar-nav-icon/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

v-app-bar-nav-icon/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

v-app-bar-nav-icon/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

v-app-bar-nav-icon/location.description: Specifies the component's location. Can combine by using a space separated string

v-app-bar-nav-icon/position.description: Specifies the type of positioning method used for the component.

v-app-bar-nav-icon/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. You can find more information on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

v-app-bar-nav-icon/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-app-bar-nav-icon/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children

v-app-bar-nav-icon/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors)

v-app-bar-nav-icon/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component

v-app-bar-nav-icon/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, a unique ID will be used.

v-app-bar-nav-icon/size.description: Sets the height and width of the component. Default unit is px. Can also use the following predefined sizes: **x-small**, **small**, **default**, **large**, and **x-large**.

v-app-bar-nav-icon/active.description: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component

v-app-bar-nav-icon/prepend-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend** slot before default content

v-app-bar-nav-icon/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot

v-app-bar-nav-icon/block.description: Expands the button to 100% of available space.

v-app-bar-nav-icon/stacked.description: Displays the button as a flex-column.

v-app-bar-nav-icon/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component

v-app-bar-nav-icon/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

v-app-bar-nav-icon/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color

v-app-bar-nav-icon/href.description: Designates the component as anchor and applies the **href** attribute.

v-app-bar-nav-icon/replace.description: Setting **replace** prop will call `router.replace()` instead of `router.push()` when clicked, so the navigation will not leave a history record. You can find more information about the [**replace** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#replace) on the vue-router documentation.

v-app-bar-nav-icon/exact.description: Exactly match the link. Without this, '/' will match every route. You can find more information about the [**exact** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact) on the vue-router documentation.

v-app-bar-nav-icon/to.description: Denotes the target route of the link. You can find more information about the [**to** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#to) on the vue-router documentation.

v-app-bar-title/text.description: Specify content text for the component.

v-app-bar-title/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-autocomplete/flat.description: Removes elevation (shadow) added to element when using the **solo** or **solo-inverted** props

v-autocomplete/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array

v-autocomplete/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state

v-autocomplete/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

v-autocomplete/rounded.description: Adds a border radius to the input

v-autocomplete/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children

v-autocomplete/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors)

v-autocomplete/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component

v-autocomplete/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component

v-autocomplete/items.description: Can be an array of objects or array of strings. When using objects, will look for a title, value and disabled keys. This can be changed using the **item-title**, **item-value** and **item-disabled** props.  Objects that have a **header** or **divider** property are considered special cases and generate a list header or divider; these items are not selectable.

v-autocomplete/active.description: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component

v-autocomplete/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the outnside the component's input, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`

v-autocomplete/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot

v-autocomplete/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the input

v-autocomplete/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color

v-autocomplete/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component

v-autocomplete/search.description: Text input used to filter items.

v-autocomplete/filter-mode.description: Apply a specific filter when matching items. **some** is the default, which will return true if any key matches the search term. **every** will return true only if every key matches the search term. The **union** mode will return true if every key matches the search term. The **intersection** mode will return true if any key matches the search term.

v-autocomplete/no-filter.description: Do not apply filtering when searching. Useful when data is being filtered server side

v-autocomplete/custom-key-filter.description: Function used on specific keys within the item object.

v-autocomplete/filter-keys.description: Array of specific keys to filter on the item.

v-autocomplete/chips.description: Changes display of selections to chips

v-autocomplete/closable-chips.description: Enables the [closable](/api/v-chip/#props-closable) prop on all [v-chip](/components/chips/) components

v-autocomplete/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

v-autocomplete/hide-no-data.description: Hides the menu when there are no options to show.  Useful for preventing the menu from opening before results are fetched asynchronously.  Also has the effect of opening the menu when the `items` array changes if not already open.

v-autocomplete/hide-selected.description: Do not display in the select menu items that are already selected

v-autocomplete/menu.description: Renders with the menu open by default

v-autocomplete/menu-props.description: Pass props through to the `v-menu` component. Accepts an object with anything from [/api/v-menu](/api/v-menu/#props), camelCase keys are recommended.

v-autocomplete/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

v-autocomplete/multiple.description: Changes select to multiple. Accepts array for value

v-autocomplete/no-data-text.description: Text shown when no items are provided to the component

v-autocomplete/open-on-clear.description: When using the **clearable** prop, once cleared, the select menu will either open or stay open, depending on the current state

v-autocomplete/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm used for values

v-autocomplete/item-title.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its title

v-autocomplete/item-value.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its value

v-autocomplete/item-children.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its children

v-autocomplete/item-props.description: Props object that will be applied to each item component. `true` will treat the original object as raw props and pass it directly to the component.

v-autocomplete/return-object.description: Changes the selection behavior to return the object directly rather than the value specified with **item-value**

v-autocomplete/persistent-placeholder.description: Forces placeholder to always be visible

v-autocomplete/persistent-counter.description: Forces counter to always be visible

v-autocomplete/hint.description: Displays hint text below the input when focused. Force this always open with the [persistent-hint](#props-persistent-hint) property

v-autocomplete/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string

v-autocomplete/direction.description: Changes the direction of the input

v-autocomplete/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation

v-autocomplete/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

v-autocomplete/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`

v-autocomplete/validate-on.description: Change what type of event triggers validation to run.

v-autocomplete/focused.description: Forces a focused state styling on the component.

v-autocomplete/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display

v-autocomplete/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors)

v-autocomplete/clearable.description: Allows for the component to be cleared

v-autocomplete/clear-icon.description: The icon used when the **clerable** prop is set to true

v-autocomplete/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused

v-autocomplete/persistent-clear.description: Always show the clearable icon when the input is dirty (By default it only shows on hover)

v-autocomplete/prepend-inner-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend-inner** slot

v-autocomplete/single-line.description: Label does not move on focus/dirty

v-autocomplete/counter.description: Creates counter for input length; if no number is specified, it defaults to 25. Does not apply any validation.

v-autocomplete/counter-value.description: Function returns the counter display text

v-avatar/end.description: Applies margin at the start of the component.

v-avatar/start.description: Applies margin at the end of the component.

v-badge/floating.description: Elevates the badge above the slotted content.

v-badge/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

v-badge/bordered.description: Applies a **2px** by default and **1.5px** border around the badge when using the **dot** property.

v-badge/dot.description: Reduce the size of the badge and hide its contents.

v-badge/inline.description: Moves the badge to be inline with the wrapping element. Supports the usage of the **left** prop.

v-badge/text-color.description: Applies a specified color to the control text - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors)

v-badge/content.description: Text content to show in the badge.

v-badge/max.description: Sets the maximum number allowed when using the **content** prop with a `number` like value. If the content number exceeds the maximum value, a `+` suffix is added.

v-badge/offset-x.description: Offset the badge on the x-axis.

v-badge/offset-y.description: Offset the badge on the y-axis.

v-banner/avatar.description: Designates a specific src image to pass to the thumbnail.

The **union** mode will return true if every key matches the search term. The **intersection** mode will return true if any key matches the search term.

v-combobox/custom-key-filter.description: Function used on specific keys within the item object.

v-combobox/filter-keys.description: Array of specific keys to filter on the item.

v-combobox/chips.description: Changes display of selections to chips

v-combobox/closable-chips.description: Enables the [closable](/api/v-chip/#props-closable) prop on all [v-chip](/components/chips/) components

v-combobox/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

v-combobox/hide-no-data.description: Hides the menu when there are no options to show.  Useful for preventing the menu from opening before results are fetched asynchronously.  Also has the effect of opening the menu when the `items` array changes if not already open.

v-combobox/hide-selected.description: Do not display in the select menu items that are already selected

v-combobox/menu.description: Renders with the menu open by default

v-combobox/menu-props.description: Pass props through to the `v-menu` component. Accepts an object with anything from [/api/v-menu](/api/v-menu/#props), camelCase keys are recommended.

v-combobox/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

v-combobox/multiple.description: Changes select to multiple. Accepts array for value

v-combobox/no-data-text.description: Text shown when no items are provided to the component

v-combobox/open-on-clear.description: When using the **clearable** prop, once cleared, the select menu will either open or stay open, depending on the current state

v-combobox/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm used for values

v-combobox/item-title.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its title

v-combobox/item-value.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its value

v-combobox/item-children.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its children

v-combobox/item-props.description: Props object that will be applied to each item component. `true` will treat the original object as raw props and pass it directly to the component.

v-combobox/return-object.description: Changes the selection behavior to return the object directly rather than the value specified with **item-value**

v-combobox/persistent-placeholder.description: Forces placeholder to always be visible

v-combobox/persistent-counter.description: Forces counter to always be visible

v-combobox/hint.description: Displays hint text below the input when focused. Force this always open with the [persistent-hint](#props-persistent-hint) property

v-combobox/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string

v-combobox/direction.description: Changes the direction of the input

v-combobox/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation

v-combobox/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

v-combobox/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`

v-combobox/validate-on.description: Change what type of event triggers validation to run.

v-combobox/focused.description: Forces a focused state styling on the component.

v-combobox/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display

v-combobox/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors)

v-combobox/clearable.description: Allows for the component to be cleared

v-combobox/clear-icon.description: The icon used when the **clerable** prop is set to true

v-combobox/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused

v-combobox/persistent-clear.description: Always show the clearable icon when the input is dirty (By default it only shows on hover)

v-combobox/prepend-inner-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend-inner** slot

v-combobox/single-line.description: Label does not move on focus/dirty

v-combobox/counter.description: Creates counter for input length; if no number is specified, it defaults to 25. Does not apply any validation.

v-combobox/counter-value.description: Function returns the counter display text

v-combobox/delimiters.description: Accepts an array of strings that will trigger a new tag when typing. Does not replace the normal Tab and Enter keys.

v-component-icon/icon.description: Apply a specific icon using the [v-icon](/components/icons/) component.

v-component-icon/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element

v-container/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-counter/active.description: Determines whether the counter is visible or not

The **union** mode will return true if every key matches the search term. The **intersection** mode will return true if any key matches the search term.

v-defaults-provider/disabled.description: Turns off all calcuations of new default values for improved performance in situations where defaults propagation isn't necessary

v-defaults-provider/root.description: Force current defaults to match the application root defaults

v-defaults-provider/scoped.description: Prevents the ability for default values to be inherited from parent components

v-defaults-provider/reset.description: Reset the default values up the nested chain by {n} amount

v-defaults-provider/defaults.description: Specify new default prop values for components. Keep in mind that this will be merged with previously defined values

v-dialog/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array

v-dialog/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

v-dialog/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

v-dialog/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

v-dialog/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

v-dialog/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

v-dialog/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

v-dialog/absolute.description: Applies **position: absolute** to the content element.

v-dialog/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children

v-dialog/z-index.description: The z-index used for the component

v-dialog/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component

v-dialog/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

v-dialog/close-on-back.description: Closes the overlay content when the browser's back button is pressed or `$router.back()` is called, cancelling the original navigation. `persistent` overlays will cancel navigation and animate as if they were clicked outside instead of closing.

v-dialog/contained.description: Limits the size of the component and scrim to its offset parent. Implies `absolute` and `attach`.

v-dialog/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component

v-dialog/no-click-animation.description: Disables the bounce effect when clicking outside of a `v-dialog`'s content when using the **persistent** prop.

v-dialog/persistent.description: Clicking outside of the element or pressing **esc** key will not deactivate it.

v-dialog/scrim.description: Accepts true/false to enable background, and string to define color.

v-dialog/open-on-hover.description: Designates whether component should activate when its activator is hovered.

v-dialog/close-on-content-click.description: Closes component when you click on its content

v-dialog/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

v-dialog/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

v-dialog/location-strategy.description: A function used to specifies how the component should position relative to its activator

v-dialog/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

v-dialog/offset.description: A single value that offsets content away from the target based upon what side it is on

v-dialog/retain-focus.description: Tab focus will return to the first child of the dialog by default. Disable this when using external tools that require focus such as TinyMCE or vue-clipboard.

v-dialog-bottom-transition/hide-on-leave.description: Hides the leaving element (no exit animation)

v-dialog-bottom-transition/leave-absolut.description: Absolutely positions the leaving element (useful for [FLIP](https://aerotwist.com/blog/flip-your-animations/))

v-list-item/exact.description: Exactly match the link. Without this, '/' will match every route. You can find more information about the [**exact** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact) on the vue-router documentation.

v-list-item/link.description: Designates that the component is a link. This is automatic when using the href or to prop.

v-list-item/active-class.description: The class applied to the component when it matches the current route. Find more information about the [active-class prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#active-class) on the [vue-router](https://router.vuejs.org/) documentation

v-list-item/active-color.description: The applied color when the component is in an active state

v-list-item/subtitle.description: Specify a subtitle text for the component.

v-list-item/append-avatar.description: Appends a [v-avatar](/components/avatars/) component after default content in the **append** slot

v-list-item/prepend-avatar.description: Prepends a [v-avatar](/components/avatars/) component in the **prepend** slot before default content

v-list-item-action/end.description: Applies margin at the start of the component.

v-list-item-action/start.description: Applies margin at the end of the component.

v-list-item-action/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-list-item-media/end.description: Applies margin at the start of the component.

v-list-item-media/start.description: Applies margin at the end of the component.

v-list-item-media/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-list-item-subtitle/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element

v-list-item-title/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element

v-list-subheader/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-list-subheader/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors)

v-main/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-menu/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array

v-menu/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

v-menu/max-height.description: Sets the max height of the menu content

v-menu/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

v-menu/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

v-menu/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

v-menu/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

v-menu/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children

v-menu/z-index.description: The z-index used for the component

v-menu/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component

v-menu/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

v-menu/close-on-back.description: Closes the overlay content when the browser's back button is pressed or `$router.back()` is called, cancelling the original navigation. `persistent` overlays will cancel navigation and animate as if they were clicked outside instead of closing.

v-menu/contained.description: Limits the size of the component and scrim to its offset parent. Implies `absolute` and `attach`.

v-menu/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component

v-menu/no-click-animation.description: Disables the bounce effect when clicking outside of the content element when using the persistent prop.

v-menu/persistent.description: Clicking outside of the element or pressing esc key will not deactivate it.

v-menu/scrim.description: Accepts true/false to enable background, and string to define color.

v-menu/open-on-click.description: Designates whether menu should open on activator click

v-menu/open-on-hover.description: Designates whether menu should open on activator hover

v-menu/close-on-content-click.description: Designates if menu should close when its content is clicked

v-menu/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component. Only works with the **open-on-hover** prop

v-menu/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component. Only works with the **open-on-hover** prop

v-menu/location-strategy.description: A function used to specifies how the component should position relative to its activator

v-menu/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

v-menu/offset.description: A single value that offsets content away from the target based upon what side it is on

v-navigation-drawer/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array

v-navigation-drawer/width.description: Sets the width for the component

v-navigation-drawer/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

v-navigation-drawer/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. You can find more information on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

v-navigation-drawer/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-navigation-drawer/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children

v-navigation-drawer/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors)

v-navigation-drawer/name.description: Assign a specific name for layout registration.

v-navigation-drawer/image.description: Apply a specific background image to the component.

v-navigation-drawer/floating.description: A floating drawer has no visible container (no border-right)

v-navigation-drawer/order.description: Adjust the order of the component in relation to its registration order.

v-navigation-drawer/disable-resize-watch.description: Will automatically open/close drawer when resized depending if mobile or desktop.

v-navigation-drawer/disable-route-watche.description: Disables opening of navigation drawer when route changes

v-navigation-drawer/expand-on-hover.description: Collapses the drawer to a **mini-variant** until hovering with the mouse

v-navigation-drawer/permanent.description: The drawer remains visible regardless of screen size

v-navigation-drawer/temporary.description: A temporary drawer sits above its application and uses a scrim (overlay) to darken the background

v-navigation-drawer/rail-width.description: Sets the width for the component when `rail` is enabled.

v-overlay/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array

v-overlay/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

v-overlay/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

v-overlay/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

v-overlay/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

v-overlay/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

v-overlay/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

v-overlay/absolute.description: Applies **position: absolute** to the content element.

v-overlay/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children

v-overlay/z-index.description: The z-index used for the component

v-overlay/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component

v-overlay/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

v-overlay/close-on-back.description: Closes the overlay content when the browser's back button is pressed or `$router.back()` is called, cancelling the original navigation. `persistent` overlays will cancel navigation and animate as if they were clicked outside instead of closing.

v-overlay/contained.description: Limits the size of the component and scrim to its offset parent. Implies `absolute` and `attach`.

v-overlay/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component

v-overlay/no-click-animation.description: Disables the bounce effect when clicking outside of the content element when using the persistent prop.

v-overlay/persistent.description: Clicking outside of the element or pressing esc key will not deactivate it.

v-overlay/scrim.description: Accepts true/false to enable background, and string to define color.

v-overlay/close-on-content-click.description: Closes component when you click on its content

v-overlay/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

v-overlay/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

v-overlay/location-strategy.description: A function used to specifies how the component should position relative to its activator

v-overlay/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

v-overlay/offset.description: A single value that offsets content away from the target based upon what side it is on

v-overlay/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

v-overlay/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element that this component should detach to. String can be any valid querySelector and Object can be any valid Node. This attaches to the root `v-app` component by default

v-pagination/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array

v-pagination/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

v-pagination/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

v-pagination/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. You can find more information on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

v-pagination/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-pagination/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children

v-pagination/color.description: Applies specified color to the selected page button - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors)

v-pagination/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component

v-pagination/size.description: Sets the height and width of the component. Default unit is px. Can also use the following predefined sizes: **x-small**, **small**, **default**, **large**, and **x-large**.

v-pagination/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component

v-pagination/active-color.description: The applied color when the component is in an active state

v-pagination/next-icon.description: The icon to use for the next button

v-pagination/prev-icon.description: The icon to use for the prev button

v-pagination/show-first-last-page.description: Show buttons for going to first and last page

v-pagination/total-visible.description: Specify the total visible pagination numbers

v-pagination/first-icon.description: The icon to use for the first button

v-pagination/last-icon.description: The icon to use for the last button

v-pagination/current-page-aria-label.description: Label for the currently selected page

v-pagination/first-aria-label.description: Label for the go to first button

v-pagination/last-aria-label.description: Label for the go to last button

v-pagination/ellipsis.description: Text to show between page buttons when truncating the list

v-progress-circular/model-value.description: The percentage value for current progress

v-progress-circular/width.description: Sets the stroke of the circle in pixels

v-progress-circular/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-progress-circular/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children

v-progress-circular/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors)

v-progress-circular/size.description: Sets the diameter of the circle in pixels

v-progress-circular/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors)

v-progress-circular/indeterminate.description: Constantly animates, use when loading progress is unknown. If set to the string `'disable-shrink'` it will use a simpler animation that does not run on the main thread.

v-progress-circular/rotate.description: Rotates the circle start point in degrees

v-progress-linear/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array

v-progress-linear/height.description: Sets the height for the component

v-progress-linear/reverse.description: Displays reversed progress (right to left in LTR mode and left to right in RTL)

v-progress-linear/location.description: Specifies the component's location. Can combine by using a space separated string

v-progress-linear/absolute.description: Applies position: absolute to the component

v-progress-linear/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. You can find more information on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

v-progress-linear/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-progress-linear/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children

v-progress-linear/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors)

v-progress-linear/active.description: Reduce the height to 0, hiding component

v-progress-linear/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors)

v-progress-linear/max.description: Sets the maximum value the progress can reach

v-progress-linear/indeterminate.description: Constantly animates, use when loading progress is unknown.

v-progress-linear/clickable.description: Clicking on the progress track will automatically set the value

v-progress-linear/stream.description: An alternative style for portraying loading that works in tandem with **buffer-value**

v-progress-linear/striped.description: Adds a stripe background to the filled portion of the progress component

v-progress-linear/rounded-bar.description: Applies a border radius to the progress bar

v-progress-linear/bg-opacity.description: Background opacity, if null it defaults to 0.3 if background color is not specified or 1 otherwise

v-progress-linear/buffer-value.description: The percentage value for the buffer

v-radio/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array

v-radio/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state

v-radio/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

v-radio/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children

v-radio/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors)

v-radio/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component

v-radio/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component

v-radio/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component

v-radio/multiple.description: Changes select to multiple. Accepts array for value

v-radio/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm used for values

v-radio-group/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array

v-radio-group/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state

Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors)

v-radio-group/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component

v-radio-group/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`

v-radio-group/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot

v-radio-group/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component

v-radio-group/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component

v-radio-group/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm used for values

v-radio-group/hint.description: Displays hint text below the input when focused. Force this always open with the [persistent-hint](#props-persistent-hint) property

v-radio-group/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string

v-radio-group/direction.description: Changes the direction of the input

v-radio-group/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation

v-radio-group/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

v-radio-group/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`

v-radio-group/validate-on.description: Change what type of event triggers validation to run.

v-radio-group/validation-value.description: The value used when applying validation rules.

v-radio-group/focused.description: Forces a focused state styling on the component.

v-radio-group/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display

v-range-slider/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display

v-rating/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children

v-rating/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors)

v-rating/size.description: Sets the height and width of the component. Default unit is px. Can also use the following predefined sizes: **x-small**, **small**, **default**, **large**, and **x-large**.

v-rating/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component

v-rating/readonly.description: Removes all hover effects and pointer events

v-rating/clearable.description: Allows for the component to be cleared by clicking on the current value

v-rating/active-color.description: The applied color when the component is in an active state

v-rating/hover.description: Provides visual feedback when hovering over icons

v-rating/half-increments.description: Allows the selection of half increments

v-rating/item-label-position.description: Position of item labels. Accepts 'top' and 'bottom'.

v-rating/item-labels.description: Array of labels to display next to each item.

v-responsive/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

v-responsive/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

v-responsive/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

v-responsive/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

v-responsive/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

v-responsive/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

v-responsive/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component

v-responsive/aspect-ratio.description: Sets a base aspect ratio, calculated as width/height. This will only set a **minimum** height, the component can still grow if it has a lot of content

v-row/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-row/align.description: Applies the [align-items](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-items) css property. Available options are: **start**, **center**, **end**, **baseline** and **stretch**.

v-row/align-md.description: Changes the **align-items** property on medium and greater breakpoints.

v-row/align-lg.description: Changes the **align-items** property on large and greater breakpoints.

v-select/flat.description: Removes elevation (shadow) added to element when using the **solo** or **solo-inverted** props

v-select/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array

v-select/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state

v-select/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

v-select/rounded.description: Adds a border radius to the input

v-select/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children

v-select/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors)

v-select/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component

v-select/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component

v-select/items.description: Can be an array of objects or array of strings. When using objects, will look for a title, value and disabled keys. This can be changed using the **item-title**, **item-value** and **item-disabled** props.  Objects that have a **header** or **divider** property are considered special cases and generate a list header or divider; these items are not selectable.

v-select/active.description: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component

v-select/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the outnside the component's input, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`

v-select/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot

v-select/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the input

v-select/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color

v-select/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component

v-select/chips.description: Changes display of selections to chips

v-select/closable-chips.description: Enables the [closable](/api/v-chip/#props-closable) prop on all [v-chip](/components/chips/) components

v-select/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

v-select/hide-no-data.description: Hides the menu when there are no options to show.  Useful for preventing the menu from opening before results are fetched asynchronously.  Also has the effect of opening the menu when the `items` array changes if not already open.

v-select/hide-selected.description: Do not display in the select menu items that are already selected

v-select/menu.description: Renders with the menu open by default

v-select/menu-props.description: Pass props through to the `v-menu` component. Accepts an object with anything from [/api/v-menu](/api/v-menu/#props), camelCase keys are recommended.

v-select/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

v-select/multiple.description: Changes select to multiple. Accepts array for value

v-select/no-data-text.description: Text shown when no items are provided to the component

v-select/open-on-clear.description: When using the **clearable** prop, once cleared, the select menu will either open or stay open, depending on the current state

v-select/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm used for values

v-select/item-title.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its title

v-select/item-value.description: Set property of **items**'s value - **must be primitive**. Dot notation is supported. **Note:** This is currently not supported with `v-combobox` [GitHub Issue](https://github.com/vuetifyjs/vuetify/issues/5479)

v-select/item-children.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its children

v-select/item-props.description: Props object that will be applied to each item component. `true` will treat the original object as raw props and pass it directly to the component.

v-select/return-object.description: Changes the selection behavior to return the object directly rather than the value specified with **item-value**

v-select/persistent-placeholder.description: Forces placeholder to always be visible

v-select/persistent-counter.description: Forces counter to always be visible

v-select/hint.description: Displays hint text below the input when focused. Force this always open with the [persistent-hint](#props-persistent-hint) property

v-select/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string

v-select/direction.description: Changes the direction of the input

v-select/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation

v-select/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

v-select/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`

v-select/validate-on.description: Change what type of event triggers validation to run.

v-select/focused.description: Forces a focused state styling on the component.

v-select/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display

v-select/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors)

v-select/clearable.description: Allows for the component to be cleared

v-select/clear-icon.description: The icon used when the **clerable** prop is set to true

v-select/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused

v-select/persistent-clear.description: Always show the clearable icon when the input is dirty (By default it only shows on hover)

v-select/prepend-inner-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend-inner** slot

v-select/single-line.description: Label does not move on focus/dirty

v-select/counter.description: Creates counter for input length; if no number is specified, it defaults to 25. Does not apply any validation.

v-select/counter-value.description: Function returns the counter display text

v-selection-control/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state

v-sheet/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

v-sheet/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

v-sheet/location.description: Specifies the component's location. Can combine by using a space separated string

v-sheet/position.description: Specifies the type of positioning method used for the component.

v-sheet/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. You can find more information on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

Will recursively generate a corresponding skeleton from the provided string. Also supports short-hand for multiple elements such as **article@3** and **paragraph@2** which will generate 3 _article_ skeletons and 2 _paragraph_ skeletons. Please see below for a list of available pre-defined options.

v-skeleton-loader/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

v-skeleton-loader/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

v-skeleton-loader/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

v-skeleton-loader/loading.description: Applies a loading animation with a on-hover loading cursor. A value of **false** will only work when there is content in the `default` slot.

v-skeleton-loader/boilerplate.description: Remove the loading animation from the skeleton

v-slide-group/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array

v-slide-group/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-slide-group/disabled.description: Puts all children components into a disabled state

v-slide-group/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

v-slide-group/multiple.description: Allows one to select mulitple items.

v-slide-group/max.description: Sets a maximum number of selections that can be made.

v-slide-group/mandatory.description: Forces at least one item to always be selected (if available).

v-slide-group/next-icon.description: The appended slot when arrows are shown

v-slide-group/prev-icon.description: The prepended slot when arrows are shown

v-slide-group/show-arrows.description: Change when the overflow arrow indicators are shown. By **default**, arrows *always* display on Desktop when the container is overflowing. When the container overflows on mobile, arrows are not shown by default. A **show-arrows** value of `true` allows these arrows to show on Mobile if the container overflowing. A value of `desktop` *always* displays arrows on Desktop while a value of `mobile` always displays arrows on Mobile. A value of `always` always displays arrows on Desktop *and* Mobile. Find more information on how to customize breakpoint thresholds on the [breakpoints page](/customizing/breakpoints).

v-slide-group/center-active.description: Forces the selected component to be centered

v-slide-group-item/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, a unique ID will be used.

v-slide-group-item/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component

v-slide-group-item/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

v-toolbar/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

v-toolbar/height.description: Designates a specific height for the toolbar. Overrides the heights imposed by other props, e.g. **prominent**, **dense**, **extended**, etc.

v-toolbar/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

v-toolbar/absolute.description: Applies position: absolute to the component.

v-toolbar/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. You can find more information on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

v-toolbar/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-toolbar/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children

v-toolbar/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors)

v-toolbar/image.description: Specifies a [v-img](/components/images) as the component's background.

v-toolbar/collapse.description: Puts the toolbar into a collapsed state reducing its maximum width.

v-toolbar/extended.description: Use this prop to increase the height of the toolbar _without_ using the `extension` slot for adding content. May be used in conjunction with the **extension-height** prop, and any of the other props that affect the height of the toolbar, e.g. **prominent**, **dense**, etc., **WITH THE EXCEPTION** of **height**.

v-toolbar/extension-height.description: Specify an explicit height for the `extension` slot.

v-toolbar-items/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors)

v-toolbar-items/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component

v-toolbar-title/text.description: Specify content text for the component.

v-toolbar-title/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-tooltip/text.description: Specify content text for the component.

v-tooltip/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array

v-tooltip/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

v-tooltip/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

v-tooltip/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

v-tooltip/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

v-tooltip/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

v-tooltip/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

v-tooltip/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children

v-tooltip/z-index.description: The z-index used for the component

v-tooltip/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component

v-tooltip/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

v-tooltip/close-on-back.description: Closes the overlay content when the browser's back button is pressed or `$router.back()` is called, cancelling the original navigation. `persistent` overlays will cancel navigation and animate as if they were clicked outside instead of closing.

v-tooltip/contained.description: Limits the size of the component and scrim to its offset parent. Implies `absolute` and `attach`.

v-tooltip/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component

v-tooltip/no-click-animation.description: Disables the bounce effect when clicking outside of the content element when using the persistent prop.

v-tooltip/scrim.description: Accepts true/false to enable background, and string to define color.

v-tooltip/open-on-click.description: Designates whether the tooltip should open on activator click

v-tooltip/open-on-hover.description: Designates whether the tooltip should open on activator hover

v-tooltip/close-on-content-click.description: Closes component when you click on its content

v-tooltip/close-delay.description: Delay (in ms) after which menu closes (when open-on-hover prop is set to true)

v-tooltip/open-delay.description: Delay (in ms) after which tooltip opens (when `open-on-hover` prop is set to **true**)

v-tooltip/location-strategy.description: A function used to specifies how the component should position relative to its activator

v-tooltip/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

v-tooltip/offset.description: A single value that offsets content away from the target based upon what side it is on

v-tooltip/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

v-tooltip/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element that this component should detach to. String can be any valid querySelector and Object can be any valid Node. This attaches to the root `v-app` component by default

v-validation/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array

v-validation/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state

v-validation/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component

v-validation/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component

v-validation/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation

v-validation/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

v-validation/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`

v-validation/validate-on.description: Change what type of event triggers validation to run.

v-validation/validation-value.description: The value used when applying validation rules.

v-validation/focused.description: Forces a focused state styling on the component.

v-virtual-scroll/height.description: Height of the component as a css value

v-virtual-scroll/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

v-virtual-scroll/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

v-virtual-scroll/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

v-virtual-scroll/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

v-virtual-scroll/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

v-virtual-scroll/items.description: The array of items to display

v-virtual-scroll/item-height.description: Height in pixels of each item to display. When using **dynamic-item-height** this should be an average initial size.

v-window/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array

v-window/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-window/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children

v-window/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component

v-window/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

v-window/mandatory.description: Forces at least one item to always be selected (if available).

v-window/continuous.description: If `true`, window will "wrap around" from the last item to the first, and from the first item to the last

v-window/next-icon.description: Icon used for the "next" button if `show-arrows` is `true`

v-window/prev-icon.description: Icon used for the "prev" button if `show-arrows` is `true`

v-window/touch.description: Provide a custom **left** and **right** function when swiped left or right.

v-window-item/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, a unique ID will be used.

v-window-item/disabled.description: Prevents the item from becoming active when using the "next" and "prev" buttons or the `toggle` method

v-window-item/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

v-window-item/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

v-window-item/transition.description: The transition used when the component progressing through items. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.
